meanings.definition: To fit or adapt something to a previous state or condition.
meanings.sent1: She had to backfit the old dress to her new size.
meanings.sent2: He decided to backfit the antique clock to its original working condition.
meanings.sent3: Trying to backfit his broken toy car back together was like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic had to backfit the engine with spare parts to get it running again.
meanings.sent5: Backfitting the puzzle pieces together, she finally completed the picture.

meanings.definition: To make adjustments to a design or system to incorporate new information or requirements.
meanings.sent1: The software developer needed to backfit the program with the latest updates.
meanings.sent2: In order to meet the new safety regulations, they had to backfit the entire building.
meanings.sent3: He had to backfit his presentation with the unexpected data he received.
meanings.sent4: The chef had to backfit the recipe with the newly available ingredients.
meanings.sent5: Backfitting the plan with the new details, they were ready to move forward.

meanings.definition: The act of retrofitting or modifying something to meet current standards or specifications.
meanings.sent1: The backfit of the old house included energy-efficient upgrades.
meanings.sent2: The backfit of the car involved installing modern safety features.
meanings.sent3: The backfit of the office space made it more functional and comfortable.
meanings.sent4: The backfit of the factory machinery improved productivity significantly.
meanings.sent5: The backfit of the technology brought the company up to date with the industry standards.
